name: Oxfam America
mission: Oxfam works with local organizations, providing funds and empowering poor people to play a central role in the development of their families, communities, and regions.
theoryOfChange: Oxfam America has a published 'Oxfam America 2030 Strategy Framework' which guides the organization in fighting inequality to end poverty and injustice. This strategic framework, approved by their Board of Directors in October 2019, lays out their core aspirations for the decade and is complemented by three-year plans. It describes how Oxfam will collaborate and innovate on a global scale, shifting resources and power to people experiencing marginalization. Additionally, Oxfam has developed a 'Corporate Inequality Framework (CIF)' to help investors analyze how companies contribute to inequality. Oxfam also utilizes a 'Global Strategic Framework 2020–2030' which aims to transform systems impacting people living in poverty or who are marginalized and excluded.

components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 32/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Oxfam AmericaHQ earns 69/100 due to strong impact and good alignment.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly)

all_citations.claim: Oxfam America holds a Charity Navigator score of 99.33333333333333/100 and maintains high financial accountability.
The organization focuses on international relief, lifesaving support, and economic justice programs.
all_citations.source_name: Download our most recent financial audit

all_citations.claim: Oxfam's programs in Ghana resulted in new laws passed with civil society input.
all_citations.source_name: Download NORAD Ghana Final Project Evaluation Report

all_citations.claim: The organization improved media capacity and civil society engagement in Mozambique.
all_citations.source_name: Download NORAD Mozambique Final Project Evaluation Report

all_citations.claim: Oxfam's advocacy efforts in Tanzania led to the adoption of legislative amendments.
all_citations.source_name: Download NORAD Tanzania Final Project Evaluation Report

all_citations.claim: Oxfam America accepts general donations and sadaqah to support its mission of empowering poor people.
The organization reported total revenue of $83,115,051 and a program expense ratio of 72.3%.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Oxfam America demonstrates exceptional financial health and transparency, though its broad humanitarian scope results in a medium alignment score for donors seeking specialized religious fit.
areas_for_improvement: Moderate donor alignment for those seeking specific Muslim-focused niche programming
High cost per beneficiary relative to some direct-provision peers

dimension_explanations.alignment: Oxfam America is categorized as SADAQAH-ELIGIBLE, making it a suitable choice for general charitable giving rather than zakat [6]. While it addresses urgent humanitarian needs, the alignment score is medium because its broad secular approach may not provide the specific religious pathways some donors prioritize [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization achieves high impact through direct provision of aid and systemic advocacy, as evidenced by its work in Ghana where civil society input led to new laws [3]. Financial efficiency is maintained with a program expense ratio of 72.3% and a fundraising efficiency of $0.19 per $1 raised [1][7]. Evaluation reports from Mozambique and Tanzania further validate their effectiveness in increasing media capacity and securing legislative amendments [4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Oxfam America empowers marginalized communities through direct international relief and systemic economic justice initiatives.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 99.33333333333333/100
Strong liquidity with 8.0 months of working capital
Effective legislative advocacy, including successfully influencing new laws and amendments in Ghana and Tanzania
baseline_narrative.summary: Oxfam America is a global organization that partners with local entities to provide lifesaving support and foster long-term development in impoverished regions [1][2]. The organization focuses on economic justice and emergency response, ensuring that local populations play a central role in their own community's progress [2][6].

all_citations.claim: eight decades since its founding in 1942
direct lifesaving support with systemic advocacy
all_citations.quote: Lifesaving Support, Economic Justice, Gender Equality, Climate Action
New laws passed with CSO input: 2

all_citations.claim: overall score of 99.99.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Oxfam America demonstrates exceptional financial health and transparency, though its broad humanitarian scope results in a medium alignment score for donors seeking specialized religious fit.

areas_for_improvement.context: The current <cite id="16">program expense ratio of 72.3%</cite> is below the <cite id="17">peer median of 89.7%</cite> for humanitarian organizations.
The organization has experienced a <cite id="18">3-year revenue CAGR of -9.1%</cite>, indicating a contraction in funding levels.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high standards of governance with a 22-member independent board.

case_against.mitigation_notes: Oxfam's high <cite id="8">working capital of 8 months</cite> provides a significant buffer against revenue fluctuations.
risk_factors: <cite id="18">Negative 9.1% revenue growth</cite> over three years
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="16">72.3% program expense ratio</cite>, which suggests higher administrative costs than some competitors.

confidence.notes: Very high confidence due to recent audited financials and third-party evaluations.

alignment.explanation: The organization aligns with Muslim donor values through its <cite id="21">lifesaving support in Gaza and Afghanistan</cite> and its focus on the poor.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be strengthened by increasing <cite id="13">grantmaking to local partners</cite> in underserved Muslim-majority regions.

credibility.explanation: Oxfam is a highly credible institution with <cite id="19">100% independent board members</cite> and a <cite id="11">Platinum Candid seal</cite>.
credibility.improvement: Credibility is already high; maintaining current <cite id="15">outcome tracking standards</cite> is recommended.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="20">cost per beneficiary of $79.01</cite>, which is considered excellent for complex humanitarian interventions.
impact.improvement: To improve impact scores, the charity should aim to increase its <cite id="16">program expense ratio toward the 75% industry standard</cite>.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes and policy wins

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Empowers local organizations to lead development and advocacy

rich_narrative.headline: Oxfam America empowers marginalized communities through direct international relief and systemic economic justice initiatives.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value a sophisticated blend of immediate disaster relief and long-term advocacy to uproot the causes of poverty.
donor_motivations: Want to support systemic economic justice
Value high transparency and third-party ratings
Interested in supporting local leadership in developing nations
Looking to provide sadaqah to established global institutions
giving_considerations: Donations support a large-scale secular institution
A portion of funds is dedicated to legislative lobbying and advocacy
Program expense ratio is lower than some smaller, leaner charities

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Verified outcomes in policy and <cite id="15">five tracked metrics</cite> demonstrate clear impact beyond simple outputs.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Oxfam uses an integrated approach to <cite id="22">combat poverty on all levels</cite> by empowering local people and influencing policy.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that advocacy efforts translate into tangible legal and economic protections for the poor.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Global humanitarian needs in Gaza and Africa currently exceed available resources.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Oxfam is distinguished by its <cite id="2">heavy emphasis on legislative advocacy</cite> compared to peers like ICNA Relief.
similar_orgs: Helping Hand for Relief and Development

similar_organizations.differentiator: More domestic US focus and Muslim-led
similar_organizations.name: ICNA Relief

similar_organizations.differentiator: Smaller scale with higher program ratio
similar_organizations.name: United Muslim Relief

strengths.detail: Oxfam holds a <cite id="9">99.33/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting rigorous governance standards.
Beyond direct aid, the organization successfully advocated for <cite id="7">two new laws in Ghana</cite> and trained journalists to improve <cite id="12">media capacity in Mozambique</cite>.
The charity maintains <cite id="8">8.0 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring operational continuity during global crises.

strengths_deep_dive: Oxfam America's strength lies in its dual-track model of emergency response and long-term systemic change. In 2024, the organization distributed <cite id="13">$19,412,103 in foreign grants</cite> to 151 recipients, primarily local partners in high-need regions. Their financial efficiency is notable, with a <cite id="14">fundraising efficiency of $0.19 per $1 raised</cite>, which is well within industry best practices. Furthermore, their commitment to evidence is demonstrated by <cite id="15">tracking five distinct outcome metrics</cite> via Candid, including specific project evaluations in West Africa and Southeast Asia.
rich_narrative.summary: Oxfam America is a global humanitarian institution that has operated for over <cite id="1">eight decades since its founding in 1942</cite>. The organization specializes in an integrated approach to poverty alleviation, combining <cite id="2">direct lifesaving support with systemic advocacy</cite> for economic justice and gender equality. With a <cite id="3">total revenue of $83,115,051</cite> in fiscal year 2024, Oxfam maintains a massive operational footprint across <cite id="4">Africa, Asia, and the Americas</cite>. Unlike many traditional relief agencies, Oxfam emphasizes <cite id="5">empowering local organizations</cite> to lead development within their own communities. Their impact is evidenced by significant policy wins, such as <cite id="6">influencing legislative amendments in Tanzania</cite> and supporting the passage of <cite id="7">new laws in Ghana</cite> through civil society input. Financially, the organization is highly stable, maintaining <cite id="8">8.0 months of working capital</cite> and earning a near-perfect <cite id="9">overall score of 99.99.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>.
